org.jgentleframework.configure.objectmeta
Interface ObjectAnnotating

All Known Subinterfaces:
InClass
All Known Implementing Classes:
InClassImpl
public interface ObjectAnnotating

This interface represents a ObjectAnnotating which be responsible for annotating executing process correspongding to an ID of a Definition which is designated in ObjectBindingConstant . Information of ObjectAnnotating shall be used conjointly with configuration data of ObjectBindingConstant in order to create bean instance, or load the Definition information.

Author:
LE QUOC CHUNG - mailto: skydunkpro@yahoo.com
See Also:
InClass

Method Detail

annotate

InClass annotate(Identification<?> key,
                 java.lang.Object... values)
Executes the annotating action in order to annotate one or more dynamic annotation instances at differrent target in current configuring ObjectBindingConstant. Hence, annotating data will be combined with injecting data in order to create the last Definition.

Parameters:
key - key is the member need to be annotated. Key could be field, method or Class of current specified class in ObjectBindingConstant. To specify key, use static methods of ReflectIdentification class.
values - the annotation instance list specified to annotated with key.
Returns:
InClass

annotate

InClass annotate(Identification<?> key,
                 java.lang.Object value)
Executes the annotating action in order to annotate one or more dynamic annotation instances at differrent member target in current configuring ObjectBindingConstant. Hence, annotating data will be combined with injecting data in order to create the last Definition.

Parameters:
key - key is the member need to be annotated. Key could be field, method or Class of current specified class in ObjectBindingConstant. To specify key, use static methods of ReflectIdentification class.
value - the annotation instance specified to annotated with key.
Returns:
InClass

annotate

InClass annotate(java.lang.Object[]... pairs)
Executes the annotating action in order to annotate one or more dynamic annotation instances at differrent member target in current configuring ObjectBindingConstant. Hence, annotating data will be combined with injecting data in order to create the last Definition.

Note: This method will be performed the same way as annotate(Types, Object[][]) method with specified 'type' argument is Types.DEFAULT

Parameters:
pairs - a list of array containing the mapping pair. One mapping pair is an array which its length is 2 (represents key and value). if violate, one exception will be thrown at run-time. Key of mapping pair is the member need to be annotated. Key could be field, method or Class of current specified class in ObjectBindingConstant. To specify key, use static methods of ReflectIdentification class.
Returns:
InClass

annotate

InClass annotate(Pair<Identification<?>,java.lang.Object>... pairs)
Executes the annotating action in order to annotate one or more dynamic annotation instances at differrent member target in current configuring ObjectBindingConstant. Hence, annotating data will be combined with injecting data in order to create the last Definition.

Parameters:
pairs - the list of pairs need to be executed.
Returns:
InClass

annotate

InClass annotate(Types type,
                 java.lang.Object[]... pairs)
Executes the annotating action in order to annotate one or more dynamic annotation instances at differrent member target in current configuring ObjectBindingConstant. Hence, annotating data will be combined with injecting data in order to create the last Definition.

Parameters:
type - the type of key of mapping pairs, only valid key associate to type value is supported when method is performed. If violate, one exception will be thrown at run-time.
pairs - a list of array containing the mapping pair. One mapping pair is an array which its length is 2 (represents key and value). if violate, one exception will be thrown at run-time. Key of mapping pair is the member need to be annotated. Key could be field, method or Class of current specified class in ObjectBindingConstant. To specify key, use static methods of ReflectIdentification class.

- Note: In case mapping pairs have variety types, type argument must be Types.DEFAULT.

Returns:
InClass

getConstant

ObjectBindingConstant getConstant()
Returns the current ObjectBindingConstant.

Returns:
ObjectBindingConstant
